content:
What a great idea! LA is home to many talented artists, and it's fantastic that you want to support local talent.

As for Shepard Fairey and Retna, I've got some good news for you:

**Shepard Fairey:**

* **Subliminal Projects Gallery**: This gallery, founded by Shepard Fairey, features his work, as well as exhibitions by other artists. They often have new shows and events, so check their website for current and upcoming exhibitions. (1331 W. Sunset Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90026)
* **Shepard Fairey's Murals**: You can find several of his murals around LA, including:
	+ "Peace Elephant" (2020) at the intersection of La Brea Avenue and 1st Street
	+ "Liberty Guides Us" (2019) at the Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles (MOCA) (250 S. Grand Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90012)

**Retna:**

* **Retna's Murals**: Retna has created numerous murals throughout LA, including:
	+ "The Geisha" (2013) at the intersection of La Brea Avenue and 2nd Street
	+ "The Dream" (2019) at the Hollywood and Highland Center (6801 Hollywood Blvd, Hollywood, CA 90028)
* ** Corey Helford Gallery**: While not exclusively a Retna exhibition space, this gallery has featured his work in the past. Keep an eye on their website for upcoming shows. (571 S. Anderson St, Los Angeles, CA 90033)

**Other Local Artists:**

* **Galerie Perrotin**: This gallery represents many notable street artists, including Takashi Murakami and JR. They often have exhibitions and events, so check their website for current and upcoming shows. (900 S. Santa Fe Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90021)
* **Hauser & Wirth**: This gallery has featured street art and urban contemporary exhibitions in the past. Keep an eye on their website for upcoming shows. (901 E. 3rd St, Los Angeles, CA 90013)

Remember to respect the art, the artists, and the communities where the murals are located. Enjoy your art adventure in LA!
